changelog.release_notes: It's cold outside. Zeiteisen now uses a signed data typed variable to display negative temperatures as well. ;)

- Vibration feature on bluetooth lost now configurable
- Not more than one vibration in five mins on BT lost
- Minimal (and still pretty ugly) Pebble 2 compatibility

- More colorful hour hand
- Slightly better visible hour markers
- More than three taps per minute are ignored
- Sleep-display's background in battery-level-color
- Fixed sleep-time wakeup detection
- Minor issues

- Show weather forecast's timestamp
- New dark gray watchface theme
- More careful access to weather service
- Watchface notifications
- Fixed some minor bugs

- Observe "Pebble Health" data to detect watch-wearer is sleeping
- Allow a raw estimation of "battery hours remaining" w/o any data
- Corrected a minor issue with the configuration dialog on Android

- Slightly bigger minute markers
- More precise battery remaining time
- Colored second hand
- Weather forecast for the next 24 hours
- Fixed some minor issues

- New date format options
- A few minor updates that you didn't even know you needed

- Spanish and french translations (only weekday on watchface)
- Bluetooth icon position on Pebble Time/Time Steel corrected
- Configuration dialog completely translated to german

- Several temperature units
- More careful access to weather service

description:
The style of this elegant analog watchface is carefully modeled on a classic wrist watch. Supports english, french, german and spanish.

Weather is taken from your phone's location by default, or can be manually configured by city name and country code (in case you've denied access to location service). Uses weather forecasts up to 24 hours when your Pebble is running without bluetooth.

You can choose between a lot of temperature units in configurations dialog: Fahrenheit, Celsius, Delisle, Kelvin, Newton, Rankine, Réaumur, Rømer.

While watch-wearer is sleeping (detected by "Pebble Health"), watchface is automatically switched-off to save energy.

The second hand is hidden by default. Shake your wrist to show it for a few seconds. You can configure the second hand to be permanently visible, but this will drain your Pebble's battery more quickly.

You can configure "No date" watchface complication, or "Date only", or "Weekday and date" (only on Time Round) in the configurations dialog.

The estimated remaining battery hours can optionally be displayed. And there is a battery meter painted in green, yellow or red colors (depending on the Pebble's battery level) between the minute markers at the bottom of the watchface. I find this a pretty cool feature. :)

There is a bluetooth icon appearing and double-vibrating when bluetooth connection with phone has been lost.

And there is more to come! BTW: If you love this watchface as much as I do, please give it a <3. Thx.
